intro: Ranunculus ficaria subsp. grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and stream banks. The plant features trifoliate leaves with a distinctive yellow sap and produces showy, yellow flowers with five to seven petals. Its flowers are usually 2–5 cm in diameter and bloom from late spring to early summer. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, known for its ornamental value and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
